Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We're seeking innovators - engineers who seek to design new products, designing state-of-the-art products that do not exist today. These engineers love to code with a drive to build global products and bring new ideas to develop security disciplines to solve real-world problems. We are looking for leaders who take ownership of their areas of focus and who are driven to pursue problems at every level. Collaboration is at the heart of our culture and we need engineers who can communicate at a high level and work well with multi-functional teams towards achieving a common goal. Job Description Your Career We are looking for a motivated, intelligent, hardworking and creative person to join the Detection Service team as a Data Scientist. You will be part of a team that develops content to power the next-generation firewall for providing cloud-based malware detection and threat research using machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) techniques. You will be applying network security knowledge and machine learning techniques to detect advanced threats and attacks. You will be working as a “full-stack” data scientist who analyzes the malware behavior, develops the ML/DL models and delivers it in the production environment for customers. Your Impact Learn how next-generation firewalls inspect network packets Gain hands-on experience with building production-grade ML/DL models for threat detection Directly impact the detection efficacy through ML/DL model delivery in Advanced Threat Prevention products Work closely with the infrastructure team for data engineering pipeline and automatic model training pipeline Develop the detection solutions and integrate the solutions into the Palo Alto Networks’ next-generation firewall using Google Cloud infrastructure Collaborate with cross-team members to convert your research into multiple products, patents, research publications, blogs etc. Qualifications Your Experience Solid knowledge of Big Data Analysis and ML/DL algorithms techniques Was able to build ML/DL models with high accuracy and low false alarms for threat detections Good understanding of standard ML/DL toolkits (Spark, SQL, Pandas, Sklearn etc) Be able to interpret the ML/DL results and improve the model to the required quality level Basic understanding of network security and layer-7 traffic analysis, such as HTTP, SSL etc Basic experience with traffic analysis tools (e.g. wireshark, tcpdump), reverse engineering tools, exploitation/environment reproduction Good programming skills, Python/scripting language or Go experience is preferred Experience with Google Cloud toolkit is a plus BS/MS in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Network Security, Information Security, or related fields is required Additional Information The Team Our Security Services Team is responsible for building next-generation threat prevention and antivirus solutions and shipping high-quality content to our products to prevent successful cyberattacks. The areas include malware analysis, IoT security, Web security, network security, privacy protection. Engineering is at the core of our products and connected directly to the mission of preventing cyberattacks. We are constantly innovating — challenging the way we, and the industry, think about cybersecurity. Our engineers don’t shy away from building products to solve problems no one has pursued before. We define the industry instead of waiting for directions. We need individuals who feel comfortable in ambiguity, excited by the prospect of a challenge, and empowered by the unknown risks facing our everyday lives that are only enabled by a secure digital environment. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. Job Description Your Career Palo Alto Networks is looking for a motivated Database Engineer with broad Relational and non-Relational Database technology background to join our Platform and Site Reliability Engineering team. You will be responsible for designing, building, deploying, and supporting database systems and data models. You will collaborate with business units to analyze current-state business processes and help modernize and build scalable and sustainable solutions to help ensure data integrity and security. Our team partners closely with IT and Engineering groups and requires individuals to bring a can-do, positive attitude, with a focus on delivering exceptional customer support. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career The Digital Experience team is looking for an outstanding Digital Product Owner to join the team and be responsible for shaping the evolution of digital experiences that deliver modern, engaging and dynamic customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have strong digital marketing and project management skills, hands-on experience working in content management systems and will play a critical role in communication and change management for large-scale initiatives. This role will partner closely with GTMs, Channel Partners, Services, SEO, Analytics, UX, Creative Services, Web Production, Marketing Technology, QA teams as well as external agencies to drive digital experiences from inception through execution. Your Impact Develop long-term strategic goals, think digital first, focus on insights and KPI-driven approach, build strong business cases and support overall digital strategy Drive and coordinate cross-functional teams of various partners that include solution marketers, writers, designers, web producers, developers, and QA leads to build and maintain digital experiences on paloaltonetworks.com. Collaborate with extended teams on digital journeys, user experience, user research, SEO, SEM, optimization, testing, and analytics to deliver measurable and successful digital experiences. Drive results-oriented digital marketing programs and initiatives. As an agile team member, accountable for day-to-day project management, gathering and documenting detailed business requirements/epics, stories, scrums, scoring and prioritizing backlog, testing, working with designers and - user acceptance and testing of features and post-production operations management. Create EPICS, user stories for current and future releases based on the insights, research and business goals. Build relationships and proactively engage with business partners and team members, advising on content best practices, identifying risks, setting expectations and establishing timelines within larger project plans. Support Leadership on various levels of value, providing updates around strategy, product, project and progress. Support governance, process innovations and business process change within marketing. Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor’s Degree required. Masters preferred. 5+ years of relevant Experience with Product Management principles, Agile and Waterfall models. Demonstrated experience in managing aggressive timelines and driving teams to success. Self-Management and supporting others - high performing. Exposure to Digital, Web, Mobile, Apps, Browsers, Devices and Cloud Technologies. Experience with enterprise CMS tools like Adobe Experience Manager and supporting tools like Adobe Analytics and Adobe Target is a plus Strong analytical and synthesis skills are a must, including the ability to coordinate with the analytics team for reporting, weekly KPI measurement and other web metrics. Good collaboration skills, team building and coaching skills - leading as well as ability to roll up sleeves and get into the details when necessary. Experience working directly with partners, Project Management, Creative Services, Web Production, Web Development, and QA teams. Good understanding of Requirements Gathering, Detailed Agile Stories, Epics, Scrums Comfortable using collaboration tools such as JIRA, Confluence, productivity apps like smartsheet, Miro etc. Proficient with feasibility analysis - build vs. buy situations Should be able to independently write requirements from brainstorming sessions Additional Information The Team Being in Marketing at Palo Alto Networks means that you will be in the midst of the changes impacting our cybersecurity industry, helping our internal teams, customers, and partners address the ever-changing threats we all face daily. Making, doing, building, and rebuilding, leading initiatives that have never been done before. We solve real problems with new ideas, striving tirelessly for simplicity. We are disruptors; we challenge entrenched beliefs and look to the future of what’s possible. We like our work to answer big questions and drive the business ahead. How do we enable more productivity and strengthen our ability to scale? How do we fuel our culture of learning, experimentation, trust, and continuous improvement? And how do we show up and collaborate with one another every day in ways that invite us to do our best work? Disruption is at the core of FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing its nature from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We firmly believe that diversity strengthens our ideas and the way we work. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating together, and for that we need you to be your true, whole self at work. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting salary (includes on-target earnings = base + on target incentives for sales roles) is expected to be between $107,800/yr to $158,600/yr. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.” Covid-19 Vaccination Information for Palo Alto Networks Jobs Vaccine requirements and

Job Description Your Career We are looking for an experienced benefits leader to join our Global Rewards Team. This individual will have a centralized focus on U.S. programs and policies with the ability to manage Canada health and welfare and retirement benefits as well. This role will report to the VP, Global People and work alongside our regional benefits teams in the U.S., EMEA, and JAPAC to help create a cohesive, employee-forward global benefits strategy for Palo Alto Networks. We are seeking a colleague who enjoys working independently but collaboratively in a collegial team environment within a fast-paced and dynamic company. Benefits Leadership Manage, support, and develop a team of benefit program managers Promote knowledge and understanding for business leaders and people business partners around benefit best practices and benchmarking Act as the subject matter expert for our AMER benefits programs and act as the escalation point for any complex issues arising from People Business Partner cases Lead, plan and manage effective communications for regional employees and partners - PBPs, HRConnect, Talent Acquisition, etc. Stay up to date on compliance updates and requirements in the AMER region and update policies and programs to align with any regulatory changes Benefits Strategy Management Drive the U.S. and Canada benefits strategies in line with Palo Alto Networks regional and corporate objectives, business strategy, and values Own/manage the relationship with our local Canada broker(s) as well as our global and U.S. consultant (Willis Towers Watson) Own/manage the relationships with key benefit vendors in the U.S. & Canada Track, measure, and report out on key benefit metrics and performance over time Ensure the ongoing compliance and competitiveness of programs through benchmarking and ROI/value assessments Assess opportunities for the regional/global alignment of programs and policies Complete RFPs and implement new programs and policies as required Benefits Administration Oversee the design and administration of all AMER benefits programs including health, retirement, life & disability, and time off/leaves of absence Support benefit program managers with day-to-day plan support, employee concerns/escalations, and vendor issues as needed Own/manage the annual financial planning process for the U.S. & Canada benefits in conjunction with internal and external partners Oversee the integration of benefit initiatives with internal and external functions (i.e. benefits operations during LOA, payroll deductions, self-insurance management, etc.) Support regional merger and acquisition initiatives in conjunction with leadership, business partners and various stakeholders for a successful integration and transition of benefits Qualifications Your Experience 10 or more years relevant experience in benefits management or benefits consulting preferred Proven track record of managing benefit plans and providers Ability to set, manage, and deliver programs within a reasonable budget as well as make decisions and trade-offs based on holistic financial metrics You are detail-oriented, and have both left-brain and right-brain strengths Superior language, written and oral, communication skills required Sense of humor and commitment to professionalism Dynamic and team oriented, with excellent interpersonal skills, business judgment, strategic thinking, superior work ethic Able to work efficiently with cross-functional teams and manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure Comfortable with ambiguity Additional Information The Team Our People team works throughout the organization to enable ... you guessed it: people. We’re one team, driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the People team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most challenging cybersecurity threats. You will be part of a growing, passionate, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects — centered on what we believe is one of the most significant mission statements in the world. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting salary (includes on-target earnings = base + on target incentives for sales roles) is expected to be between $154,600 to $227,200. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. This role will report to the VP, Global People and work alongside our regional benefits teams in the U.S., EMEA, and JAPAC to help create a cohesive, employee-forward global benefits strategy for Palo Alto Networks. We are seeking a colleague who enjoys working independently but collaboratively in a collegial team environment within a fast-paced and dynamic company. Benefits Leadership Manage, support, and develop a team of benefit program managers Promote knowledge and understanding for business leaders and people business partners around benefit best practices and benchmarking Act as the subject matter expert for our AMER benefits programs and act as the escalation point for any complex issues arising from People Business Partner cases Lead, plan and manage effective communications for regional employees and partners - PBPs, HRConnect, Talent Acquisition, etc. Stay up to date on compliance updates and requirements in the AMER region and update policies and programs to align with any regulatory changes Benefits Strategy Management Drive the U.S. and Canada benefits strategies in line with Palo Alto Networks regional and corporate objectives, business strategy, and values Own/manage the relationship with our local Canada broker(s) as well as our global and U.S. consultant (Willis Towers Watson) Own/manage the relationships with key benefit vendors in the U.S. & Canada Track, measure, and report out on key benefit metrics and performance over time Ensure the ongoing compliance and competitiveness of programs through benchmarking and ROI/value assessments Assess opportunities for the regional/global alignment of programs and policies Complete RFPs and implement new programs and policies as required Benefits Administration Oversee the design and administration of all AMER benefits programs including health, retirement, life & disability, and time off/leaves of absence Support benefit program managers with day-to-day plan support, employee concerns/escalations, and vendor issues as needed Own/manage the annual financial planning process for the U.S. & Canada benefits in conjunction with internal and external partners Oversee the integration of benefit initiatives with internal and external functions (i.e. benefits operations during LOA, payroll deductions, self-insurance management, etc.) Support regional merger and acquisition initiatives in conjunction with leadership, business partners and various stakeholders for a successful integration and transition of benefits Qualifications Your Experience 10 or more years relevant experience in benefits management or benefits consulting preferred Proven track record of managing benefit plans and providers Ability to set, manage, and deliver programs within a reasonable budget as well as make decisions and trade-offs based on holistic financial metrics You are detail-oriented, and have both left-brain and right-brain strengths Superior language, written and oral, communication skills required Sense of humor and commitment to professionalism Dynamic and team oriented, with excellent interpersonal skills, business judgment, strategic thinking, superior work ethic Able to work efficiently with cross-functional teams and manage numerous projects simultaneously under deadline pressure Comfortable with ambiguity Additional Information The Team Our People team works throughout the organization to enable ... you guessed it: people. We’re one team, driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the People team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most challenging cybersecurity threats. You will be part of a growing, passionate, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects — centered on what we believe is one of the most significant mission statements in the world. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting salary (includes on-target earnings = base + on target incentives for sales roles) is expected to be between $154,600 to $227,200. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. Unless applicable law requires otherwise, you must be vaccinated for COVID or qualify for a reasonable accommodation if: The job requires accessing a company worksite The job requires in-person customer contact and the customer has implemented such requirements You choose to access a Palo Alto Networks worksite If you have questions about the vaccine requirements of this particular position based on your location or job requirements, please inquire with the recruiter.

Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Who We Are We are Palo Alto Network’s Americas Places Team, part of the Global People & Places team. We are leading the future of work with FLEXWork - our employee-centric approach to how, when and where our people work! We are looking for a Director of Americas Workplace Operations, based in Santa Clara, CA. This role reports to the Senior Director of Americas Places. The position will manage a regional team responsible for all aspects of workplace operations, services and facilities management for over 24 leased and owned properties throughout the US, Canada & Latin America, including our 1M SF Global Headquarters in Santa Clara, CA. This role is critical to driving our business, culture and sustainability goals across our Americas offices. The right person will craft and elevate our spaces and services that make employees want to choose to work from our offices every single day. We are looking for a dynamic and mission-driven individual with a passion for delivering world-class experiences that allow our employees to do their best work any place, any time! Job Description Your Impact Provide leadership to the Americas Workplace Operations Team supporting sustainability, repairs & maintenance, reception, mailroom, janitorial, and moves/adds/changes within the offices and labs Initiate and maintain vendor relationships including energy, utilities, repairs & maintenance (HVAC, plumbing, electrical, etc), janitorial, movers, furniture, pest control, plants, appliances, shipping, and catering Manage existing vendor contracts and ensure SLAs are being met, including hosting QBRs - Team with Procurement on new vendor agreements (RFP/bidding), or issues with existing agreements Engage proactively in Corporate Social Responsibility; drive our Places Sustainability Strategy and sustainable building standards to deliver spaces that enhance our occupants' health and reduce our carbon footprint to achieve Palo Alto Networks target of net zero by 2030 Develop a diverse and well-trained regional team and encourage professional growth and development Onboard new vendors, establish POs, and be the point person for payment and invoicing issues, including our new regional IFM service partner Establish and maintain a strong working relationship with Landlord/Property Management teams and Tenants for 3 PANW owned properties Ensure all service requests through PANW’s internal ticketing system are being responded to in a timely manner and appropriately, per established SLAs, ensuring top customer service levels Work with the wider Places team, comprising Real Estate, Workplace Strategy and Workplace Experience on new workplace initiatives Maintain financial responsibility for the development and management of the operations budget for all sites and monthly accrual and forecast reports - Review and approve all department expense reports, PO requests, and invoice approvals Collaborate with Real Estate, Workplace Strategy team members, and business unit contacts on headcount projections - Coordinate the management of moves/adds/changes (MACs) or restacks as required Develop and oversee all Workplace Operations communications Who You Are Positive, supportive, leader Professional, friendly, approachable demeanor You are independent, flexible, an excellent communicator with a growth mindset and the ability to quickly respond to changes as they occur You are self-directed and have strong organization, verbal/written communication and problem-solving skills, with the ability to execute tasks in an efficient and timely manner You have a strong ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced, fluid environment Creative problem-solver with a knack for designing and implementing great new processes Ability to remain energetic and positive in a fast-paced environment Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor degree or equivalent Minimum 12 years of professional experience in real estate/facilities/property management, with at least 6 years in a management capacity, preferably in a mid-large scale enterprise - Experience leading diverse and remote staff is desired Experience in developing and implementing an Energy/Sustainability strategy is preferred Strong financial reporting and budgeting background and understanding of leases, vendor service agreements, design, planning, construction, and maintenance of equipment, buildings, and other facilities Familiarity with Google Workspace, Slack and Zoom applications and a working knowledge of IWMS, CAD and other relevant workplace operations applications Familiarity with KPIs, OKRs, SLAs and measuring metrics helpful Flexibility with regard to job responsibilities Willingness to function as after-hours contact for facility emergencies and be accessible via phone Travel is necessary Additional Information Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. Disclosure required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum compensation (includes on-target earnings = base + on target incentives for sales roles) for this role to be located in the state of Colorado. If hired in Colorado, this position starts at $154,800/yr. Depending on the position offered, restricted stock units and incentive or bonus pay may be provided as part of this compensation package. Additional benefits may be found here. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career As Director of Cloud Security Architecture, you will lead the effort to secure the largest, fastest growing security company in the world! You will lead a team of security architects and engineers responsible for setting the direction and strategy for Cloud Architecture. In addition, you will coordinate efforts across Palo Alto Networks’ Operations, Attack Surface Management, Network, IaC/PaC, SOC and Platform Services Engineering on all cloud security topics Your Impact Directly manage a team of Cloud Security Architects that establish Cloud Security Architecture patterns and standards, design security solutions, and review proposed designs from across the organization to ensure alignment with Security/Privacy/Data protection standards. Provide architectural guidance and leadership, coordinate delivery of security, defense, and operational capabilities for Palo Alto Networks’ public cloud Provide domain expertise around public cloud and enterprise technology Develop security architecture standards, frameworks, guidelines, and design patterns spanning all layers of security in the cloud, from the host, server, and network to application and data security Effectively manage team resources to ensure security is represented across Palo Alto networks Engineering teams Work with other critical leaders across the organization to optimize and drive process efficiency in all aspects of security Architecture engagement and execution Experience building prototypes, proof of concepts, or full product deployments. Provide recommendations and implementation guidance for the security of the public cloud Deliver meaningful metrics and reporting across a range of security services to inform decisions based on accurate, up-to-date measurements of threat and risk Identify opportunities for security tooling and automation with the goal of translating security standards into policy as code and infrastructure as code that is secure by default. Mentor, coach, and develop architects to grow their skills and become thought leaders across Palo Alto Networks and the global Security community. Lead with code, automation, and data in everything you do Review and enhance security policies and operational procedures that provide continuous security for our public cloud platforms  Define baseline security standards for securing in AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes Make recommendations on secure integration strategies, global enterprise architectures, and application infrastructure based on best practices. Qualifications Your Experience 8 to 10 years of experience in infrastructure security OR experience in DevOps as an architect/manager/director in large-scale, distributed software projects, preferably with cloud service providers (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS) 4-6 years of experience with GCP/AWS cloud architecture and security Leadership skills include coaching and mentoring, critical thinking, facilitation, change leadership, and team development Experience securing, architecting, designing and implementing highly-distributed global cloud-based environments, specifically in GCP and AWS. Experience developing/securing/supporting cloud-based applications in Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, and Gov Cloud Experience with structured, secure enterprise architecture practices, hybrid cloud environments, and on-premise to cloud roadmaps. Ability to collaborate across organizational boundaries, build relationships and achieve broader organizational goals. Experience in designing and securing cloud platforms. Good working knowledge of infrastructure security concepts, including firewalls, DMZs, intrusion detection/prevention systems, network security, application security concepts, password management, RBAC, access provisioning, SIEM , and OWASP. Experience with the phases of the software development lifecycle Experience with common vulnerability scanning and penetration testing tools Knowledge of common computer security issues, including network and application vulnerabilities Thorough understanding of computer networking, routing, and protocols. Have sound security concepts with proficiency in public cloud security, networking, host security, and shared responsibility model. Deep understanding of security controls for modern architecture, especially AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes-based delivery platforms Experience in threat modeling, security code reviews for cloud-native applications, and Infrastructure as Code to identify security flaws. Education Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university; or equivalent training, education, and experience in information / cyber security, computer systems, IT, etc. Additional Information The Team While Palo Alto Networks vigilantly protects the world against cyber bad actors, the Palo Alto Networks Global Safety & Security team works tirelessly in the background to see that our buildings, assets and people are always safe and secure, both domestically and overseas. Even in some of the world’s hotspots, our employees know there are people with a plan watching out for them and their families 24/7/365! Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. To learn more about our culture and dedication to inclusion and innovation, visit our careers page. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. Additionally, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career As a member of our GCP Cloud Engagement Team, you will build and drive global co-sell teams to exceed company revenue objectives while growing our security platform partnership with GCP You’ll be responsible for building a high-performance sales culture that delivers results in bookings, sales development, and forecast accuracy while simultaneously mentoring and developing your team members to accomplish individual and organizational goals. A challenge inspires you, rather than intimidates you, and you aren’t afraid of setting accelerated goals to drive you to succeed. More than that, you are motivated by empowering our partners clients to meet their cybersecurity needs and you are driven with an encompassing passion for solutions selling. The Director, GCP Global Cloud Engagement will report to the VP, Cloud Engagement, GCP but will have several dotted line coordination requirements for consistent communication and engagement with Business Development, Marketing, Channels, Inside Sales and Product Marketing/Development. This position will be knowledge expert on all aspects of GCP and will be asked to present at QBRs, executive meetings, training and events. Your Impact Manage and lead a team of Public Cloud Alliance Managers driving a $350+ million business with sales teams in achieving and exceeding revenue targets, building pipeline, and landing new customer logos with GCP Develop a regional business plan with clear actions to exceed regional revenue targets and build well qualified pipeline Work closely with regional sales leadership, Sales Engineering and Professional Services teams to build complete solution based proposals Deliver well-inspected, accurate weekly sales forecasts and pipeline management Support Palo Alto Network’s field sales organization on engagement management with GCP Insure Cloud Engagement Managers have well documented regional and engagement plans aligned with the GCP partnership objectives and differentiated strengths of the company Disciplined review Cloud Alliance Managers objectives on target enterprises, including follow up on leads generated from marketing campaigns as well as leveraging own network/relationships Assure District Sales Managers execute on leveraging alliances and relationships with key Partners in the region Evangelize the Palo Alto Networks Enterprise Security Platform with GCP leadership and partner communities and act as an ambassador for the GCP partnership globally Provide an escalation point for pre-sales and post sales issues for any activity with the Public Cloud provider Qualifications Your Experience Proven ability to effectively manage sales or alliance teams with cloud partners Strong track record of over achievement against quarterly and annual sales targets Demonstrable experience in high-tech enterprise sales working with leading high-tech companies Demonstrate executive gravitas sufficient to engage negotiate and win new relationships at CXO level in our targeted partner markets Industry knowledge of security product market trends and directional awareness of Palo Alto Network’s roadmap and technology development efforts. Channel experience including selling with or managing channel partners is preferred Knowledge of how to deliver comprehensive security solutions to PAN’s customer base, and maintains a general understanding of competitive selling strategies Demonstrated ability to work in a virtual and matrix environment Excellent communication skills with high-level decision Proven track record of structuring large complex deals Minimum Bachelors degree from a leading university or equivalent military experience required Team player with a positive attitude and good customer service skills High levels of self-motivation, adaptability, ease of handling multiple responsibilities and able to work on own with minimal supervision "Whatever it takes" attitude and motivation to do whatever necessary to assist in winning business Ability to travel regionally and internationally Bachelor's degree or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security. As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyber threats. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Your Impact Manage and lead a team of Public Cloud Alliance Managers driving a $350+ million business with sales teams in achieving and exceeding revenue targets, building pipeline, and landing new customer logos with GCP Develop a regional business plan with clear actions to exceed regional revenue targets and build well qualified pipeline Work closely with regional sales leadership, Sales Engineering and Professional Services teams to build complete solution based proposals Deliver well-inspected, accurate weekly sales forecasts and pipeline management Support Palo Alto Network’s field sales organization on engagement management with GCP Insure Cloud Engagement Managers have well documented regional and engagement plans aligned with the GCP partnership objectives and differentiated strengths of the company Disciplined review Cloud Alliance Managers objectives on target enterprises, including follow up on leads generated from marketing campaigns as well as leveraging own network/relationships Assure District Sales Managers execute on leveraging alliances and relationships with key Partners in the region Evangelize the Palo Alto Networks Enterprise Security Platform with GCP leadership and partner communities and act as an ambassador for the GCP partnership globally Provide an escalation point for pre-sales and post sales issues for any activity with the Public Cloud provider Qualifications Your Experience Proven ability to effectively manage sales or alliance teams with cloud partners Strong track record of over achievement against quarterly and annual sales targets Demonstrable experience in high-tech enterprise sales working with leading high-tech companies Demonstrate executive gravitas sufficient to engage negotiate and win new relationships at CXO level in our targeted partner markets Industry knowledge of security product market trends and directional awareness of Palo Alto Network’s roadmap and technology development efforts. Channel experience including selling with or managing channel partners is preferred Knowledge of how to deliver comprehensive security solutions to PAN’s customer base, and maintains a general understanding of competitive selling strategies Demonstrated ability to work in a virtual and matrix environment Excellent communication skills with high-level decision Proven track record of structuring large complex deals Minimum Bachelors degree from a leading university or equivalent military experience required Team player with a positive attitude and good customer service skills High levels of self-motivation, adaptability, ease of handling multiple responsibilities and able to work on own with minimal supervision "Whatever it takes" attitude and motivation to do whatever necessary to assist in winning business Ability to travel regionally and internationally Bachelor's degree or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security. As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyber threats. Job Description Your Career Palo Alto Networks has an exciting opportunity for an experienced and highly motivated Director, Sales Finance to join our team. In this role, you will work closely with the VP of North America Finance and business partners in North America Sales to help drive strategic decision-making, provide financial insight, and build operational rigor and efficiency. This leader will also partner with Speedboat Finance teams and collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Sales Operations on a regular basis. Being successful in this role requires a large degree of analytical thought leadership, excellent organization and communication skills, and the ability to synthesize complex data and solve problems. Impact Business Partnering. Finance partner to key Sales leaderships within North America. Develop an understanding of their business and translate that into operational and financial information. Help develop various metrics to monitor the health of the business on a regular basis. Review and advise on new business offering proposals and provide balanced recommendations that support both business growth and financial integrities. Planning for North America Theater. Translate Go-to-market strategy and company goals into annual Bookings, OPEX and HC plans. Actively engaged in the planning processes for North Americas, including bookings modeling, interlock between Theater and Speedboat (BU) topline planning, investment and Sales HC capacity analysis. Quarterly / Monthly Close, Forecast and Reporting. Participate in North America Sales financial close and forecast process. Provide monthly and quarterly financial reporting, analysis and key metrics that enable business decision making. Deal Review and Support.. Own North America Sales Finance deal exception review / approval process. Develop a thorough understanding of the products, offerings, and go-to market motions, provide financial advice on deal economics, partner with PANFS team to enable the field when appropriate. Lead Projects to drive efficiency and process improvement. Identify, design and lead projects intended to create efficiencies, standardize business practices, drive process improvements and deliver high impact analysis for decision making. Team Leadership. Lead team, drive changes and help determine priorities. Continuously develop and coach individual contributors. Job Description Your Career Threat actors continue to find ways to breach and disrupt organizations making security a key boardroom conversation. Palo Alto Networks has built a brand and reputation as an industry-leading security vendor making it one of the best companies to supercharge your career. As the Director of Product Management for WildFire at Palo Alto Networks, you will be responsible for one of the largest cloud-based advanced malware detection and protection solutions embedded across the Palo Alto Networks portfolio. You will bring to Palo Alto Networks strong communication and leadership skills combined with a strong technical background in security. However, most importantly, you will possess a real passion and focus on protecting our customers from threats. You will team up with some of the best security minds in the industry and a large install base of customers. You will have access to some of the richest security data in the industry that will help you turn it into insights that deliver tangible security outcomes for our customers. Your Impact Take ownership and be accountable for one of the largest security products within the portfolio and continue to drive an innovative and differentiated roadmap that disrupts the market while helping WildFire reach its full potential Coach and mentor team members reach their full potential and further their careers Collaborate with engineering and product management leaders across the organization to help Palo Alto Networks deliver the best in class security solutions Be intimately involved with the business to identify growth opportunities and leverage your business and technical skills to enter new markets Qualifications BS or MS in a technical field (e.g. EE. CS); MBA highly desirable 5-10 years of experience in a technical product management role preferably with cloud-based security solutions covering malware analysis, incident response, forensics, sandboxing technology, intrusion prevention, antivirus, or related technologies 5 years experience managing high performing teams of product managers Track record of successfully launching net new products or offerings at scale within mature technology areas Strong analytical skills to make data-driven decisions Excellent written and verbal communications skills to drive alignment at all levels of the organization and across cross functional teams Additional Information The Team To stay ahead of the curve, it’s critical to know where the curve is, and how to anticipate the changes we’re facing. For the fastest growing cybersecurity company, the curve is the evolution of cyberattacks and the products and services that proactively address them. Our Product Management Team helps us do just that. This team provides the behind-the-scenes support for our products by being a source of information for our systems engineers, staying on top of the environment we sell in, and helping to implement technical solutions based on our client’s feedback and needs. As threats and technology evolve, we stay ahead to accomplish our mission. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Job Description Your Career Palo Alto Networks InfoSec is the largest user of our Products globally, and critical operational feedback from the InfoSec team is key to helping ensure our Products are always exceptional as we continue to be the global cyber security leader. Reporting to the SVP, CISO, the Director of Product Management (InfoSec) plays a crucial role in Palo Alto Networks. You will drive innovation across the entire security portfolio. Our platforms represent the foundation of our security offering - providing you an opportunity to help define the future of the security industry by solving critical problems and reestablishing what’s possible in this space. You will have ownership of the above offering from concept definition to launch and beyond. In addition, you will work very closely with additional product managers throughout the organization. Your Impact Validate that the 60+ products in our Security Platforms are fully adopted internally across our enterprise Validate that optimum security features are enabled and configured Influence product change through analysis and sharing of essential product feedback, including issues & enhancements, to the individual Product Managers Ensure that the InfoSec team is knowledgeable on the hundreds of product enhancements that occur every year Share with customers how we use our best-of-breed Platforms to protect our company, product, and customers Work with key internal stakeholders presenting and explaining our security solutions while being able to understand and articulate their requirements Qualifications Your Experience 4+ years of experience in product management, preferably in cyber security Domain expertise in cyber security is highly desirable Experience and comfort with working with and communicating to key company stakeholders Strong technical, analytical and got-to-market skills Domain expertise in cyber security as well as a passion for driving security within an organization highly desirable Ability to bridge the gap between business requirements and market trends History of developing and delivering vision, strategy and plans to engineering and company leadership Hands-on nature with strong interest in new technology products High persuasive and logical driven, as much of the role will be influencing Passion for interacting with customers Education Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university , equivalent training, education, and experience in information / cyber security, computer systems, IT, or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Serious mission, fun culture; We’re not your ordinary Information Security team. We’re a diverse group of security professionals that embraces challenging the status quo in order to protect Palo Alto Networks and our customers. They say it’s the people you work with that make you want to go to work and it’s true here; we love our work. Think about it: Driving innovation on the Information Security team of the fastest-growing high-tech cybersecurity company is a once in a lifetime opportunity. You’ll be joined by the brightest minds in technology, and our global teams are on the front line of defense against cyberattacks. We’re joined by one mission – but driven by the impact of that mission and what it means to protect our way of life in the digital age. Join a dynamic and fast-paced team that feels excitement at the prospect of a challenge and feels a thrill every time we beat the bad guys. We hope to meet you soon! Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Job Description Your Career As Director, Sales Compensation Administration, you will be responsible for driving operational excellence in monthly commission operations, including commission forecast, accruals, implementation of SOX controls, payout, and comp plan implementation. Consults and provides expertise to sales management regarding sales compensation best practices and trends. Works collaboratively and with a high-level of influence cross-functionally with Sales, Finance, IT, Human Resources and other functions as needed. The candidate will also be responsible for identifying and driving process improvements as well as defining and documenting policies related to Sales Compensation. You will possess a mastery level of knowledge of commission and sales incentives. Includes demonstrated knowledge of sales standards, best practices, methodologies, and frameworks for sales comp operations and process management. Advanced working knowledge and ability to conduct various statistical and quantitative analysis. Your Impact In partnership with Sales Operations and the Data Analytics team, lead the comp plan implementation and day-to-day operations. Gauge the efficacy of existing methodologies and strategies and provide input into overall plan design to drive key sales outcomes and leadership objectives Manage monthly processing and attainment calculations - Supervise, provide guidance and audit the calculations and analyses performed by the compensation team Serve as the primary system administrator of the Callidus Sales Compensation system and lead initiatives to streamline and automate all processes related to sales compensation Partner with various teams within Sales Operations, Billing, and Sales leadership to identify and implement process improvements Document existing processes that are internal to the sales compensation team (e.g. procedures related to the on-boarding and off-boarding of Sales reps, commission approval process) as well as those intended for Sales teams (e.g. Sales FAQs) Identify and serve as subject matter expert in enhancing other processes that may impact sales compensation Devise, document and socialize policies for complex and unique sales/selling situations Provide analytical support (assessment of historical data, pipeline, etc.) and ad-hoc research and analysis on other related variable pay projects as identified by management - Summarize findings and communicate recommendations to senior leadership Qualifications Your Experience At least 8-10 years of sales compensation experience with progressively increasing responsibility and complexity of work in a fast paced technical environment Experience leading compensation for a hybrid product and SaaS environment Strong management skills and ability to cultivate a high-performing global team Strong knowledge of sales incentive compensation concepts, sales data tracking processes, and methodologies Ability to manipulate large data sets and conduct scenario analyses/modelling Keen focus on accuracy Advanced skills required in Callidus, Salesforce.com, Anaplan, People AI, Excel and Tableau Ability to influence key stakeholders and partners throughout the business Excellent verbal, analytical, written communication and interpersonal skills Self-starter with exemplary organization and resolution management skills Demonstrated experience of successfully executing against tight deadlines, with a collaboration mind-set Must be able to skilfully prioritize and manage concurrent projects and issues Experience working with cross-functional/cross-departmental and virtual teams at a senior level Preferred experience-Working knowledge and experience in leading project & change management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, Lean, XP, etc.) Additional Information The Team Our People team works throughout the organization to enable ... you guessed it: people. We’re one team, driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the People team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most challenging cybersecurity threats. You will be part of a growing, passionate, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects — centered on what we believe is one of the most significant mission statements in the world. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: protecting our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyber attacks. It’s not a small goal. It isn’t simple either, but we aren’t in this for the easy answer. As a company with a foundation in challenging the way things are done, we’re looking for innovators with a dedication to best. In return, your career will have a tangible impact – one that's working toward technology that affects every level of society. Our mission doesn’t happen by treading softly – no, it happens by defining an industry. It means building products that haven't been thought of. It means selling products with a solutions mindset. It means supporting the infrastructure of a company that moves at an incredible speed – intentionally – to stay ahead of the world’s next cyberthreat. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together Job Description As a Senior Architect, you will provide strategic architecture leadership to large engineering teams on large and complex projects for SaaS Security services. You understand the business imperatives tied to these strategic projects. You provide technology leadership, drive the architecture and high level design, are the technical expert on strategic projects, drive the release strategy and guide the delivery of projects aligned to the business strategy. You maintain awareness of dependencies between projects and delivery vision, while ensuring engineering excellence to the five nines. You build the strategy for your teams to architect, design and deliver the next gen SaaS Security solutions. Your Impact Drives the architecture for key cross team / cross product development projects (via architecture/design documents and developing key code modules) Develops architectures that are inherently secure, robust, scalable, modular, API-centric and global Establishes software development patterns and best practices via examples and shipping code- Ensures project teams follow a common set of principles, patterns and utilize a standard set of technology frameworks and libraries- Own and contribute to the internal engineering standards documents Provides leadership across the SaaS Security organization via the Architecture meetings and ad-hoc engagements; ensure solutions are built in alignment with platform principles and standards Applies architecture best practices that helps increase execution velocity- Align solutions with the SaaS Security vision Lead and/or Influence technology selection for SaaS Security solutions Partner with Product Managers to define/refine roadmap, discuss trade-offs of key features and architectures, help them balance features, innovation and tech debt prioritization- Be a “sounding board” for PM ideas, propose new features and innovation ideas Partner with Devops teams and other peers across the team to develop best-of-breed deployment architectures Demonstrates thought leadership through presentations and teaching across the team Qualifications Your Experience 15 years of work experience preferably with a Masters degree (in computer science) or a minimum of 10 years of work experience with a PhD (in computer science) Prior experience as a Senior architect supporting a large scale cloud security product engineering team Proven track record of successful architecture and design for high transactions and data volume in enterprise and/or consumer facing applications 5+ years of experience in Cloud technologies - AWS plus at least one other cloud provider (Azure, GCP or OCI) 12+ years of experience with large scale cloud applications experience built with one or more these languages: Java, Scala, GoLang, Python Expert in database technologies (e.g., MemSQL, SQL, Cassandra, etc.), queuing systems (e.g., Kafka, Pulsar, Akka streams, etc.). The ideal candidate will have 10+ years of experience in these technologies 3-4 yrs experience in Apache Spark, data analytics frameworks Good understanding of security, cloud security domain a plus. Senior/Chief Architect experience with an enterprise security product (on-prem or cloud) Industry influence - track record of contributing code to open source projects Proven ability to work with international teams and track record of delivering large projects Track record day-to-day coaching and mentoring principal and senior engineers. Ability to partner and influence Directors/Sr. Managers and drive architecture execution. It means supporting the infrastructure of a company that moves at an incredible speed – intentionally – to stay ahead of the world’s next cyberthreat. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together Job Description As a Senior Architect, you will provide strategic architecture leadership to large engineering teams on large and complex projects for SaaS Security services. You understand the business imperatives tied to these strategic projects. You provide technology leadership, drive the architecture and high level design, are the technical expert on strategic projects, drive the release strategy and guide the delivery of projects aligned to the business strategy. You maintain awareness of dependencies between projects and delivery vision, while ensuring engineering excellence to the five nines. You build the strategy for your teams to architect, design and deliver the next gen SaaS Security solutions. Your Impact Drives the architecture for key cross team / cross product development projects (via architecture/design documents and developing key code modules) Develops architectures that are inherently secure, robust, scalable, modular, API-centric and global Establishes software development patterns and best practices via examples and shipping code- Ensures project teams follow a common set of principles, patterns and utilize a standard set of technology frameworks and libraries- Own and contribute to the internal engineering standards documents Provides leadership across the SaaS Security organization via the Architecture meetings and ad-hoc engagements; ensure solutions are built in alignment with platform principles and standards Applies architecture best practices that helps increase execution velocity- Align solutions with the SaaS Security vision Lead and/or Influence technology selection for SaaS Security solutions Partner with Product Managers to define/refine roadmap, discuss trade-offs of key features and architectures, help them balance features, innovation and tech debt prioritization- Be a “sounding board” for PM ideas, propose new features and innovation ideas Partner with Devops teams and other peers across the team to develop best-of-breed deployment architectures Demonstrates thought leadership through presentations and teaching across the team Qualifications Your Experience 15 years of work experience preferably with a Masters degree (in computer science) or a minimum of 10 years of work experience with a PhD (in computer science) Prior experience as a Senior architect supporting a large scale cloud security product engineering team Proven track record of successful architecture and design for high transactions and data volume in enterprise and/or consumer facing applications 5+ years of experience in Cloud technologies - AWS plus at least one other cloud provider (Azure, GCP or OCI) 12+ years of experience with large scale cloud applications experience built with one or more these languages: Java, Scala, GoLang, Python Expert in database technologies (e.g., MemSQL, SQL, Cassandra, etc.), queuing systems (e.g., Kafka, Pulsar, Akka streams, etc.). The ideal candidate will have 10+ years of experience in these technologies 3-4 yrs experience in Apache Spark, data analytics frameworks Good understanding of security, cloud security domain a plus. Senior/Chief Architect experience with an enterprise security product (on-prem or cloud) Industry influence - track record of contributing code to open source projects Proven ability to work with international teams and track record of delivering large projects Track record day-to-day coaching and mentoring principal and senior engineers. Ability to partner and influence Directors/Sr. Managers and drive architecture execution. Strong executive presence and an ability to present technology strategies, discuss trade-offs, present good/bad news to executives and C-level staff. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career As a member of our sales leadership team, you will build and drive regional major account sales teams to exceed company objectives while growing your region according to plan. You’ll be responsible for building a high-performance sales culture that delivers results in bookings, sales development, and forecast accuracy while simultaneously mentoring and developing your team members to accomplish individual and organizational goals. It will be required that you track sales activity, provide sales projects, and create and analyze metrics. A challenge inspires you, rather than intimidates you, and you aren’t afraid of setting accelerated goals to drive you to succeed. More than that, you are motivated by empowering our clients to meet their cybersecurity needs and you are driven with an encompassing passion for solutions selling. You’re not afraid of addressing the critical challenges they are facing within digital transactions – and really, you thrive on the pressure. Your Impact Responsible for building and developing a team of quota carrying and lead generation sales professionals Own and drive revenue outcomes within the assigned region, territories, and/or district, exceeding personal and team sales quotas and goals Review weekly forecast and business outcomes with representatives and sales leaders Coach, develop, and mentor representatives to success in all aspects of the sales cycle - lead generation, qualification, forecasting, and closing opportunities, while using our channel/partner network Build sales analysis for insight into weekly, monthly and quarterly execution and strategies Attend weekly regional forecast and management calls to provide Inside Sales perspective Work closely with other District Sales Managers on crafting business strategy to accomplish company goals Required to stay knowledgeable and up-to-date on product roadmap, industry changes, and competitive landscapes Qualifications Your Experience Sales experience and management experience: preferably experience handling both quotas carrying and lead generation inside sales teams Enterprise sales experience required - networking or network security industries strongly preferred Experience with channel and partner sales models Consistently achieved sales goals through your leadership and personal goals Able to learn new technology quickly, as well as adapt to changing needs Hired, developed and retained successful sales talent Deep understanding of enterprise sales methodology that you can translate and coach others in Built strong cross-functional relationships across clients, partners, and internal teams Previous practice in Salesforce.com 25% quarterly travel within region Additional Information The Team Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security. As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
