Job Description Your Career The Palo Alto Networks Public Cloud Operations Manager is part of the team assigned to Azure on a global basis. This position is responsible for providing leadership, management, and strategy for the sell with/go-to-market engagement and all joint activities with Azure. The Operations Manager will have a myriad of different responsibilities to ensure leverage and consistent engagement with Azure to drive customer engagements, qualified pipeline, and cloud bookings that meet and exceed quota and expectations. The Operations Manager will be part of the team that coordinates Palo Alto Networks sales activities and will be a central conduit for engagement management between the Palo Alto Network’s sales organization and Azure. The Public Cloud OperationsManager will report to the Director of Public Cloud Business Development but will have several dotted line coordination requirements for consistent communication and engagement with Engagement Managers, IT, Finance, Marketing, Channels, Inside Sales and Product Marketing/Development. This position will be knowledge expert on all aspects of Azure and will be asked to present at QBRs, executive meetings, training, and events. The Cloud Operations Manager is regarded as being highly strategic to the company and the Public Cloud initiative in regards to strategy, influence, and execution. The Operations Manager is required to contribute to the larger Palo Alto Network’s Public Cloud strategy outside of their day-to-day activities and will be called upon for their subject matter expertise in training, QBRs, enablement, and other engagement activities. It is expected that the Cloud Engagement manager has consistent interaction and engagement with key stakeholders in Azure and internally , in support of the “sell with” activities with Azure. The Operations Manager will demonstrate a deep understanding of Azure go-to-market strategies including but not limited to marketplace processes, support processes, co-selling, strategic planning and goal setting, channel programs, marketing campaigns and programs, strategic events, and funnel management. Since this is a global role, the Public Cloud Operations manager must be able to manage activities on a worldwide scale with sufficient attention to all four theaters. Your Impact Manage all marketplace related activities with Azure Track all opportunities particularly related to marketplace, pipeline and bookings and provide forecasts and funnel management reports Provide analytics on key metrics such as bookings, pipeline Act as the interface between the Azure team and IT, Finance, Sales Ops to provide inputs in the automation business requirements documents, testing and implementation for all marketplace enhancements Be familiar with all new upcoming features in Azure marketplace and identify automation opportunities within these Manage all the current and future listings and offer creation on Azure marketplace Support the engagement managers in all theaters in publishing and booking private offers and plans on Azure marketplace Resolve issues with Azure support for exceptions Maintain dashboard of PANW’s Azure spend, perform analysis v/s commit spend Facilitate co-selling opportunities, account mapping and other sales engagements between Palo Alto Network’s field sales, Azure engagement managers and the Azure sales teams Support Palo Alto Network’s field sales organization on engagement management with Azure Coordinate activities and have involvement with the Public Cloud virtual team of Business Track all deal metrics to help develop annual strategic plan and performance goals for the overall Azure partnership Understand and articulate Azure’s strategic initiatives and gain a deep understanding of the activities, roadmap and vision of Azure Provide an escalation point for marketplace, product support and integration related issues for any activity with Microsoft Build and maintain relationships with key personnel in Azure to solidify Palo Alto Network’s standing and awareness within the provider and to assist in the development of key relationships with the extended Palo Alto Network’s cloud team and executives Help provide insight in the support of Public Cloud events and attend/participate in the events Provide support in the form of expertise and training for Palo Alto Network’s field sales enablement Qualifications Your Experience BA, BS (or equivalent work experience), MBA preferred or equivalent military experience required 5+ Years experience in Sales Operations, Finance Operations, IT 3+ years of proven worldwide experience is preferred Public Cloud experience preferred Channel experience including selling with or managing channel partners is preferred Industry knowledge of security product market trends and directional awareness of Palo Alto Network’s roadmap and technology development efforts Knowledge of how to deliver comprehensive security solutions to PANW’s customer base, and maintains a general understanding of competitive selling strategies Demonstrated ability to work in a virtual and matrix environment Proven ability to manage a myriad of different disciplines and tasks in a high pressure, time-sensitive environment Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills "Whatever it takes" attitude and motivation to do whatever necessary to assist in winning business Additional Information The Team Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security. As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyber threats. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Company Description This position is located in the state of California, available to work remotely or in a local office. Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career As a Cortex Regional Sales Manager, you will cover our SLED and Education customers. Your portfolio includes XDR, Xpanse, XSOAR, and Unit42. As we continue to grow as an organization, we are hiring field sales professionals to run and drive sales engagements into a set of new SLED and Education accounts. You will be expected to exceed sales quota by creating and implementing strategic account plans targeting enterprise wide deployments. Partnering with a systems engineer, you will displace competing technologies and build market share within your targeted list of major accounts. You are motivated by a hunger to solve critically difficult challenges that face our clients. You develop trusted relationships at a high executive level, focusing on the strategic nature of the partnership. This means that you have a concrete understanding of our product suites, and are able to help identify areas that can be resolved by our solutions. Your credibility will guide customers in their search to transition to a more secure online environment. You feel empowered by our product offerings - and love a technical challenge. Your Impact Acquire, lead, and develop major accounts within your assigned region Strong account management skills to identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities within targeted major accounts Conduct effective presentations to C—level sales planning, leading to accurate forecasting of the business Establish relationships with and sell through channel partners Demonstrate knowledge of cybersecurity industry, products, and competitor offerings Qualifications Your Experience 8+ years of key customer, field sales experience within the cybersecurity industry Expertise in the State, Local, and Education customer segments Strong communication both written and verbal, including presentation skills for clients and internal partners Enterprise sales experience with an actionable rolodex of decision makers Very strong organizational and interpersonal skills Experience working with Channel partners and understanding of a channel centric go to market approach Possess a deep understanding of the complexities around products and technology integrations Local travel is required, with international travel when necessary Bachelor's degree or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security. As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. Job Description Your Career As a member of the Palo Alto Networks Civilian sales team, you will report to the District Sales Manager for the Civilian district. Working together with a Systems Engineer, you will be accountable for delivering creative solutions to Civilian accounts - EPA and USDA. You will be responsible for managing your territory to deliver above quota sales performance. Palo Alto Networks has chosen to go to market with Security Focused Channel partners; you will be responsible for working with appropriate channel partners and collaborating on the delivery and sales of specific solutions for our customers requirements. You feel empowered by our product offerings - and love a technical challenge. Your Impact Civilian Sales Executive with a highly successful experience selling security appliances and/or software including but not limited to - Firewalls, SSL/IPSec VPNs, Security Proxies and Caches, Cloud Security solutions, and Endpoint Security Previous success factors include overachievement of quota, top performer, history of initial seeding of accounts, and closing large enterprise deals Lead identifying and signing appropriate channel partners as well as training them on our solutions Guide your customers in their search to transition to a more secure online environment Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent or equivalent military experience required 5+ years of above quota sales experience as an IT Sales professional Deep knowledge of Civilian agencies Self-motivated Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills, both internally and externally Enterprise sales experience with and actionable contacts of decision makers Superb organizational skills "Whatever it takes" attitude and motivation to deliver above quota performance Experience working with Channel partners and understanding of a channel centric go to market approach Additional Information The Team Palo Alto Networks has brought technology to market that is reshaping the cybersecurity threat and protection landscape. Our ability to protect digital transactions is limited only by our ability to establish relationships with our potential customers and help them understand how our products can protect their environments. This is where our sales teams come in. Our sales team members work together with large organizations to keep their digital information safe. Job Description Your Career Become a member of the Revenue Accounting team at Palo Alto Networks! We are seeking a highly motivated Revenue Analyst who is excited to join a high growth Company. The ideal candidate must possess strong critical thinking and communication skills. This person will perform revenue close accounting activities while working with key stakeholders, lead projects, develop new processes and improve on the month-end close process. The position requires a hands-on person who is flexible, solutions-oriented and works well under pressure. Your Impact Own monthly revenue close procedures, including preparation of revenue and deferred revenue related journal entries, reconciliations and close presentations Perform revenue and deferred revenue analytics and trends to provide visibility into relationships and drive revenue optimization initiatives Assist in discount patten analysis and carve-in and carve-out for our products Partner with cross-functional business partners and third parties to implement best practices, automation, and continuous process improvements Support revenue related system implementations and user acceptance testing Assist with external audit requests and special projects and ad hoc requests as needed Qualifications Your Experience Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, CPA preferred or equivalent military experience required 1+ years of progressive relevant experience required or 2+ years public accounting experience Familiarity with close processes, account reconciliations, and journal entry preparation Ability to build relationships across multiple functions and implement new processes Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage competing priorities and execute with accuracy and efficiency Intermediate to advanced Excel skills required Proficiency in Google Suite a plus Experience with SAP ERP revenue accounting a plus Experience with high technology clients in the Hardware, Software and/or SaaS space a plus Additional Information The Team You have a passion for numbers, our organization has a passion for cybersecurity. You’re looking for a career with a more fulfilling mission. We have open positions to top talent seeking a financial challenge. Our accounting department deals with numbers daily, supporting infrastructure, dealing in automation, building solutions and providing accurate, insightful financial information to empower our business lines. The ideal candidate has exceptional skills in accounting and analytics and an innovative mindset to approach finance problems differently. Our innovation doesn’t stay in Research and Development. Within finance and accounting, we seek people who are looking to try new things, while solving business critical equations. If you’re seeking a financial challenge but with a world-wide impact – this is it. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. Job Description Your Career The primary mission of the Global Sales Effectiveness Development Lead is to define, develop and execute enablement programs that drive Palo Alto Networks' Cortex business units growth. We are looking for an impactful and creative leader to develop and drive the execution of global sales effectiveness for the Cortex business unit inside of Palo Alto Networks. This highly motivated team player will co-create and deliver product and sales training programs globally. This is a strategic role that requires a balance of technical expertise with a strong roll-up your sleeves and 'get it done' mentality. Success requires teaming with key stakeholders from our product management, product marketing, industry go-to market, sales and sales enablement teams to create and drive the enablement process, identifying key next steps, gaps and ultimately driving programs through the execution lifecycle. This position will have a focus on product learning across the entire Palo Alto Networks Cortex platform. Your Impact Participate in the creation, development and delivery of the global Cortex sales effectiveness programs, in a cross-functional manner, focusing on product and process learning needs Self-starter, owner of end-to-end program development, delivery, measurement, communication Contribute to sales effectiveness program strategy, design, and execution for Cortex in partnership with the central Learning and Development (L&D) leadership team Co-design with the L&D team scalable, interactive enablement programs that personalize the learning journey of specialists, generalists and partners Identify and prepare instructors for instructor lead deep learning and scenario based programs (both in-person and virtual) Manage key logistical tasks including course assignments and scheduling Communicate project details and updates to project team, appropriate governance team(s), and key business stakeholders Develop and manage messaging in support of the execution and success of each learning program Design and management of metrics based systems to track success and needs of programs Help identify and integrate new learning technologies Model and participate in a culture of continuous improvement by actively collecting feedback through various methods (e.g., assessments, survey’s, focus groups, etc.), evaluating learning effectiveness, and recommending changes to optimize the learning experience Qualifications Your Experience Background in solution engineering, product management, product marketing, sales or technical enablement Deep understanding of selling security technology Advanced project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and related tasks, people, and deadlines Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships while delivering results in a highly complex, matrixed global organization Strong interpersonal and presentation skills that span across various cultures and professional backgrounds Good working understanding of key project management tools including and presentation tools Courage to challenge perspectives, and give and receive constructive and honest feedback Preferred 1 to 3 years previous enablement experience 2+ years in the security industry Direct, inside, channel or technical sales experience Experience with LMS systems Hands-on experience with video editing software, creative design Additional Information Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. jobTitle: Senior Business Development Manager, Technical Partners
jobDescription: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career You will manage technology partnerships for our NGFW and Security Services product offerings that will solve security business challenges and manage integration pipeline and evaluation and recommendations for partnership to move to our higher tiers. This individual will work with both Business Development technical leads, as well as GTM, marketing and Product Management teams , along with partner counterparts to drive efforts from onboarding partnership to evaluating and presenting on recommendations for emerging partnerships that can drive joint value and co-sell opportunities. The role will focus on delivering measurable results, including, analysis and recommendations for potential emerging partnerships validation pipeline, event metrics, opportunity influence, and focused GTM efforts that will drive co-sell opportunities. What makes PANW’s Technology Partnerships team special Every technology company has a Technology Partnerships team. What makes the team at Palo Alto Networks special is the following: Security is one of the most fragmented technology stacks. A typical large enterprise has up to 75 different security products. Customers expect our products to support integrations with hundreds of other products. APIs are not an afterthought but a critical component of our upstream product design, the MVP feature set, and subsequent roadmap updates. Our APIs are extremely well maintained and frequently updated. In certain product areas like Cortex xSOAR, we commit to giving our partners the same APIs and integration hooks that we make available to our internal teams for integrations within the PANW Product Suite. We have the most comprehensive product portfolio in the Security industry. As a result, we are building the most comprehensive and diverse product ecosystem. It extends from start-ups to the titans of the tech industry. It includes ISVs across all security categories, SaaS, Cloud Service Providers, Developer Stack, Identity & Access Management, Mobile Device Management, Email Providers, Analytics, Hardware OEMs, Network Equipment Providers, Network Infrastructure Providers, etc. Building our tech ecosystem requires a versatile set of partnership motions. In products like Cortex and Cortex xSOAR, our goal is to enable hundreds of partners to build applications to unlock a vast library of use cases. In other products like Next-Generation Firewall, we already have hundreds of integrations and are focused on ensuring these integrations stay validated as we update our core platform, move to the cloud, and launch new APIs. In Prisma Cloud and Prisma Access, the goal is to partner deeply with a relatively short list of Cloud Service Providers and Network Solution Providers. We have dedicated Partner Engineering and Solution Architect resources that work jointly with our partner managers in delivering high quality, secure, and reliable integrations. In certain instances, we build and maintain integrations. In other cases, we prescribe reference architectures and we validate the technical implementations. Sometimes, we even act as the first level of support so our customers can have reliable experiences. Our tech partnerships team is in the process of moving from a manual process to one that is more automated for better partner experience. The focus of the company in the last 3 years was to exponentially grow and onboard partners to meet customer needs and enhance our product offerings. With the need to validate existing partnerships and define a more mature approach to technology alliances, there is a big need to build, manage, and automate a program and processes. The company over the last few years has made many acquisitions and enhancements to the portfolio, and now has a multi-core business that includes the creation of the speedboats aligned to Strata, Cortex, and Prisma Cloud. As we are building end to end solutions, it has brought more complexity and extension of technology partnerships that include both inbound and outbound integrations. As we refine and grow the ecosystem, process and automation need to grow with us and allow the team to engage more partnerships yet limit resources needed to manage and drive deliverables. Your Impact Work closely with product management and go-to-market sales and marketing teams to define the partnership ecosystem for product segments within the Strata product group and partner verticals (current focus is Core NGFW group and Cloud-Delivered Security Services group, which can change with the product and go-to-market needs and internal focus future changes). Build and execute a plan for the segments of the product partnerships ecosystem defined above. Qualify, onboard, and manage relationships with strategic emerging and focus integration partners to generate clear and significant business value (brand recognition, metrics of the opportunities pipeline created, influenced, and direct revenues). Build an end-to-end partnership with clear business and customer value that have significant measurable value for all parties. Build and execute business plans with emerging partners. Oversee and support technical integration work, use case built, integration guides, and solution briefs. Build, coordinate, and lead various go-to-market initiatives including internal, intercompany, intra-companies, and external activities (customer, channel, and other routes to market we can amplify in the ecosystems team such as GSIs, MSSPs, SPs). Build relationships with senior and management-level leadership internally and with partner companies. Drive and Work on complex “coopetition scenarios” with partners, defining areas of cooperation or technical integration work for customers or partners’ needs. jobTitle: Senior Business Development Manager, Technical Partners
jobDescription: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career You will manage technology partnerships for our NGFW and Security Services product offerings that will solve security business challenges and manage integration pipeline and evaluation and recommendations for partnership to move to our higher tiers. This individual will work with both Business Development technical leads, as well as GTM, marketing and Product Management teams , along with partner counterparts to drive efforts from onboarding partnership to evaluating and presenting on recommendations for emerging partnerships that can drive joint value and co-sell opportunities. The role will focus on delivering measurable results, including, analysis and recommendations for potential emerging partnerships validation pipeline, event metrics, opportunity influence, and focused GTM efforts that will drive co-sell opportunities. What makes PANW’s Technology Partnerships team special Every technology company has a Technology Partnerships team. What makes the team at Palo Alto Networks special is the following: Security is one of the most fragmented technology stacks. A typical large enterprise has up to 75 different security products. Customers expect our products to support integrations with hundreds of other products. APIs are not an afterthought but a critical component of our upstream product design, the MVP feature set, and subsequent roadmap updates. Our APIs are extremely well maintained and frequently updated. In certain product areas like Cortex xSOAR, we commit to giving our partners the same APIs and integration hooks that we make available to our internal teams for integrations within the PANW Product Suite. We have the most comprehensive product portfolio in the Security industry. As a result, we are building the most comprehensive and diverse product ecosystem. It extends from start-ups to the titans of the tech industry. It includes ISVs across all security categories, SaaS, Cloud Service Providers, Developer Stack, Identity & Access Management, Mobile Device Management, Email Providers, Analytics, Hardware OEMs, Network Equipment Providers, Network Infrastructure Providers, etc. Building our tech ecosystem requires a versatile set of partnership motions. In products like Cortex and Cortex xSOAR, our goal is to enable hundreds of partners to build applications to unlock a vast library of use cases. In other products like Next-Generation Firewall, we already have hundreds of integrations and are focused on ensuring these integrations stay validated as we update our core platform, move to the cloud, and launch new APIs. In Prisma Cloud and Prisma Access, the goal is to partner deeply with a relatively short list of Cloud Service Providers and Network Solution Providers. We have dedicated Partner Engineering and Solution Architect resources that work jointly with our partner managers in delivering high quality, secure, and reliable integrations. In certain instances, we build and maintain integrations. In other cases, we prescribe reference architectures and we validate the technical implementations. Sometimes, we even act as the first level of support so our customers can have reliable experiences. Our tech partnerships team is in the process of moving from a manual process to one that is more automated for better partner experience. The focus of the company in the last 3 years was to exponentially grow and onboard partners to meet customer needs and enhance our product offerings. With the need to validate existing partnerships and define a more mature approach to technology alliances, there is a big need to build, manage, and automate a program and processes. The company over the last few years has made many acquisitions and enhancements to the portfolio, and now has a multi-core business that includes the creation of the speedboats aligned to Strata, Cortex, and Prisma Cloud. As we are building end to end solutions, it has brought more complexity and extension of technology partnerships that include both inbound and outbound integrations. As we refine and grow the ecosystem, process and automation need to grow with us and allow the team to engage more partnerships yet limit resources needed to manage and drive deliverables. Your Impact Work closely with product management and go-to-market sales and marketing teams to define the partnership ecosystem for product segments within the Strata product group and partner verticals (current focus is Core NGFW group and Cloud-Delivered Security Services group, which can change with the product and go-to-market needs and internal focus future changes). Build and execute a plan for the segments of the product partnerships ecosystem defined above. Qualify, onboard, and manage relationships with strategic emerging and focus integration partners to generate clear and significant business value (brand recognition, metrics of the opportunities pipeline created, influenced, and direct revenues). Build an end-to-end partnership with clear business and customer value that have significant measurable value for all parties. Build and execute business plans with emerging partners. Oversee and support technical integration work, use case built, integration guides, and solution briefs. Build, coordinate, and lead various go-to-market initiatives including internal, intercompany, intra-companies, and external activities (customer, channel, and other routes to market we can amplify in the ecosystems team such as GSIs, MSSPs, SPs). Build relationships with senior and management-level leadership internally and with partner companies. Drive and Work on complex “coopetition scenarios” with partners, defining areas of cooperation or technical integration work for customers or partners’ needs. Qualifications Your Experience 3+ years’ experience business development and driving Integration technology partnerships and ecosystems Drive to grow existing business and develop innovative, and disruptive partnerships Ability to multitask and operate to manage critical partnerships and support the development of a low touch model of partnerships. Experience in SaaS Subscription, cloud-delivered offering and Security Markets. Experience in building meaningful technology partnerships and ecosystems. Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Economics or Finance) or equivalent practical experience. MBA or graduate degree in management or technical field (optional). Experience with MS-office, G-suite, SFDC, PRM tools. Ability to independently create, design, and develop solutions very successfully in a high-visibility role and in an extremely fast-paced, dynamic environment. Self-directed, professionally assertive, and self-driven. Job Description Your Career You will be part of the IT StratOps, a growing, outcome driven, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on strategic and exciting projects. In this critical and highly visible role you will be building out the change management function from the ground up and lead IT transformation. This position will report to the Director, Business Operations. Your Impact Developing change management strategies and frameworks based on business environment, stakeholder needs, and the desired future state Design and deliver high-impact communications and stakeholder engagement programs in a consistent way Lead the IT transformation journey to execute with excellence @scale - This includes driving the adoption of process and technology changes Develop and own communication and change management roadmap with measurable well defined outcomes Articulate change impact and business readiness for large strategic initiatives Be the change evangelist with an agile mindset who focuses on increasing effectiveness and efficiency for the IT organization Craft and curate high impact internal and external content, blogs, and manage social media presence for senior executives Design, develop and lead key IT training programs with clearly defined objective and outcomes ensuring learning transfer Partner with and influence senior leadership to drive forward IT-wide change programs Qualifications Your Experience Prior experience working in a consulting firm leading and implementing Organizational Change Management (OCM) Experience with change management methodologies (PROSCI, Kotter, etc.) Exceptional written & verbal communication and listening skills - Candidate should be willing to share samples of previously created content as part of the interview process Proven ability to manage ambiguity, and a preparedness to take on what is needed to get things done Highly organized and detail oriented Prior experience of leading operational programs is a plus Additional Information The Team This is not a traditional IT department !! We continuously challenge the status quo and build solutions to make IT services better. We also partner closely with our security, engineering and product teams, to secure our state of the art cyber security solutions. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career Are you frustrated with the lack of innovation in the IoT/OT security space? Have you ever wondered how you could apply your IoT/OT expertise to drive this evolving market? Palo Alto Networks is building a world-class product management organization and continues to look for top-notch talent to expand the team. As a Senior Competitive Strategist at Palo Alto Networks, you will be responsible for defining the future of the Internet of Things (IoT) and Operational Technology (OT) Security environments and continuing to drive innovation into our network security portfolio. This role provides you an opportunity to solve key problems for our customers and reestablish what’s possible in this evolving space. You will be responsible for analyzing a set of competitors to provide product and engineering leadership with an objective assessment of Palo Alto Networks’ position in the market. You will help maintain our position as the market leader as well as educate internal teams on the competitive landscape. To be successful in this position, you must possess a combination of strong technical acumen and analytical skills, as well as a passion for cybersecurity while bridging customer business requirements with key competitors and market trends. You must have a track record of building actionable analysis, hands-on product experience, and collaborating with key stakeholders. Your Impact This is a highly strategic role centered around helping position Palo Alto Networks’ IoT and OT solutions in a highly competitive and fast-moving industry This role reports to the Senior Manager of Competitive Strategy for our Network Security business unit and provides insights on competitor strategies, strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, threats, and strategic plans This role entails a combination of strategic and hands-on responsibilities that include analyzing product functionality, capabilities, and platforms at the technical feature level The successful candidate will be very clear-minded, inventive, collaborative, data-driven, objective, and able to see trends before they happen You’ll help develop our forward-looking product strategies with the product leaders, providing enough tension in the process to ensure a great outcome, yet collaborative to arrive at unified recommendations Qualifications Your Experience BS/MS or equivalent or equivalent military experience required 8+ years in the cybersecurity industry 2+ years experience in the IoT/OT industry in a technical capacity Competitive intelligence experience in cybersecurity is a plus, but not a requirement Very strong (written and verbal) communication and presentation skills Strong interpersonal skills contributing to cross-functional teams Experience in fast-paced environments with overlapping projects/deliverables Passion for working with technical individuals and a proven ability to distill complex concepts into easy-to-understand creative analysis A consultative approach and an aptitude for translating market dynamics into actionable recommendations Proven analytical and problem-solving skills required Additional Information The Team To stay ahead of the curve, it’s critical to know where the curve is, and how to anticipate the changes we’re facing. For the fastest-growing cybersecurity company, the curve is the evolution of cyberattacks and the products and services that proactively address them. Our Product Management Team helps us do just that. Our organization and employees are committed to changing as rapidly as our industry’s threats do, and to do that, we need creative product teams to address emerging cyber threats. They provide behind-the-scenes support for our products by being a source of information on our products for our systems engineers, staying on top of the environment we sell in, and helping to implement product-wide technical solutions based on our client’s feedback and needs. As threats and technology evolve, we stay ahead to accomplish our mission. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting salary (includes on-target earnings = base + on target incentives for sales roles) is expected to be between $136,000/yr to $200,000/yr. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Offensive Security, Proactive Services (Unit42)- Remote
jobDescription: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. Job Description Your Career The Senior Consultant on the Offensive Security team is focused on assessing and challenging the security posture across a comprehensive portfolio of clients. The individual will utilize a variety of tools developed and act as a key team member in client engagements. They will be the client’s advocate for cybersecurity best practices and will provide strong recommendations in this domain. Your Impact Assist in development of internal infrastructure design for research, development, and testing focused on offensive security Conducts periodic scans of networks to find and detect vulnerabilities Performs client penetration testing to find any vulnerabilities or weaknesses that might be exploited by a malicious party, using open-source, custom, and commercial testing tools Ability to assist in scoping engagements by clearly articulating various penetration approaches and methodologies to audiences ranging from highly technical to executive personnel Report generation that clearly communicates testing and assessment details, results, and remediation recommendations to clients Develop scripts, tools, and methodologies to automate and streamline internal processes and engagements Conducts IT application testing, cybersecurity tool and systems analysis, system and network administration, and systems engineering support for the sustainment of information technology systems (mobile application testing, penetration testing, application, security, and hardware testing) Conduct threat hunting and/or compromise assessment engagements to identify active or dormant indicators of compromise (IoCs) using Crypsis and Palo Alto Networks’ threat hunting tools (and/or client owned hunting instrumentation where applicable) Assist Crypsis Leadership in the development of security standards and best practices for the organization and recommend security enhancements as needed Able to conduct cyber risk assessments using frameworks or standards like NIST CSF, ISO 27001/2, PCI, CIS Top 20, CMMC, or other industry measurement tools Conduct cloud penetration testing engagements to assess specific workloads (i.e., AWS, GCP, Azure, containers, or other PaaS and SaaS instances) for vulnerabilities and subsequently attempt to exploit identified weakness after receiving permission from client stakeholders Provide recommendations to clients on specific security measures to monitor and protect sensitive data and systems from infiltration and cyber-attacks including response and recovery of a data security breach Ability to perform travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 30%) Qualifications Your Experience 4+ years of professional experience with risk assessment tools, technologies, and methods focused on Information Assurance, Information Systems/Network Security, Infrastructure Design, and Vulnerabilities Assessments Demonstrate a deep understanding of how malicious software works (i.e.-malware, trojans, rootkits, etc.) Ability to modify known and/or craft custom exploits manually without dependence on consumer tools such as Metasploit Strong knowledge of tools and techniques used to conduct network, wireless, and web application penetration testing Familiarity with web application penetration testing and code auditing to find security gaps and vulnerabilities Knowledge and experience in conducting cyber risk assessments using industry standards Experience with penetration testing, administering, and troubleshooting major flavors of Linux, Windows, and major cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS providers (i.e., AWS, GCP, and Azure) Experience with scripting and editing existing code and programming using one or more of the following - Perl, Python, ruby, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java Experience with security assessment tools, including Nessus, OpenVAS, MobSF - Metasploit, Burp Suite Pro, Cobalt Strike, Bloodhound, and Empire Knowledge of application, database, and web server design and implementation Knowledge of network vulnerability assessments, web and cloud application security testing, network penetration testing, red teaming, security operations, or 'hunt' Knowledge of open security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic tools, technologies, and methods Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security, or equivalent years of professional experience to meet job requirements and expectations or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Unit 42 Consulting is Palo Alto Network's security advisory team. Our vision is to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is composed of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics, and information security. With a highly successful track record of delivering mission-critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide an effective incident response, attack readiness, and remediation plans with a focus on providing long-term support to improve our clients’ security posture. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $127,600/yr to $159,500/yr. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic tools, technologies, and methods Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security, or equivalent years of professional experience to meet job requirements jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Offensive Security, Proactive Services (Unit42)- Remote
jobDescription: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career The Senior Consultant on the Offensive Security team is focused on assessing and challenging the security posture across a comprehensive portfolio of clients. The individual will utilize a variety of tools developed and act as a key team member in client engagements. They will be the client’s advocate for cybersecurity best practices and will provide strong recommendations in this domain. Your Impact Assist in development of internal infrastructure design for research, development, and testing focused on offensive security Conducts periodic scans of networks to find and detect vulnerabilities Performs client penetration testing to find any vulnerabilities or weaknesses that might be exploited by a malicious party, using open-source, custom, and commercial testing tools Ability to assist in scoping engagements by clearly articulating various penetration approaches and methodologies to audiences ranging from highly technical to executive personnel Report generation that clearly communicates testing and assessment details, results, and remediation recommendations to clients Develop scripts, tools, and methodologies to automate and streamline internal processes and engagements Conducts IT application testing, cybersecurity tool and systems analysis, system and network administration, and systems engineering support for the sustainment of information technology systems (mobile application testing, penetration testing, application, security, and hardware testing) Conduct threat hunting and/or compromise assessment engagements to identify active or dormant indicators of compromise (IoCs) using Crypsis and Palo Alto Networks’ threat hunting tools (and/or client owned hunting instrumentation where applicable) Assist Crypsis Leadership in the development of security standards and best practices for the organization and recommend security enhancements as needed Able to conduct cyber risk assessments using frameworks or standards like NIST CSF, ISO 27001/2, PCI, CIS Top 20, CMMC, or other industry measurement tools Conduct cloud penetration testing engagements to assess specific workloads (i.e., AWS, GCP, Azure, containers, or other PaaS and SaaS instances) for vulnerabilities and subsequently attempt to exploit identified weakness after receiving permission from client stakeholders Provide recommendations to clients on specific security measures to monitor and protect sensitive data and systems from infiltration and cyber-attacks including response and recovery of a data security breach Ability to perform travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 30%) Qualifications Your Experience 4+ years of professional experience with risk assessment tools, technologies, and methods focused on Information Assurance, Information Systems/Network Security, Infrastructure Design, and Vulnerabilities Assessments Demonstrate a deep understanding of how malicious software works (i.e.-malware, trojans, rootkits, etc.) Ability to modify known and/or craft custom exploits manually without dependence on consumer tools such as Metasploit Strong knowledge of tools and techniques used to conduct network, wireless, and web application penetration testing Familiarity with web application penetration testing and code auditing to find security gaps and vulnerabilities Knowledge and experience in conducting cyber risk assessments using industry standards Experience with penetration testing, administering, and troubleshooting major flavors of Linux, Windows, and major cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS providers (i.e., AWS, GCP, and Azure) Experience with scripting and editing existing code and programming using one or more of the following - Perl, Python, ruby, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java Experience with security assessment tools, including Nessus, OpenVAS, MobSF - Metasploit, Burp Suite Pro, Cobalt Strike, Bloodhound, and Empire Knowledge of application, database, and web server design and implementation Knowledge of network vulnerability assessments, web and cloud application security testing, network penetration testing, red teaming, security operations, or 'hunt' Knowledge of open security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic tools, technologies, and methods Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security, or equivalent years of professional experience to meet job requirements and expectations or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Unit 42 Consulting is Palo Alto Network's security advisory team. Our vision is to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is composed of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics, and information security. With a highly successful track record of delivering mission-critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide an effective incident response, attack readiness, and remediation plans with a focus on providing long-term support to improve our clients’ security posture. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $127,600/yr to $159,500/yr. security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic jobTitle: Senior Consultant, Offensive Security, Proactive Services (Unit42)- Remote
jobDescription: Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. We’re changing the nature of work. Palo Alto Networks is evolving to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Job Description Your Career The Senior Consultant on the Offensive Security team is focused on assessing and challenging the security posture across a comprehensive portfolio of clients. The individual will utilize a variety of tools developed and act as a key team member in client engagements. They will be the client’s advocate for cybersecurity best practices and will provide strong recommendations in this domain. Your Impact Assist in development of internal infrastructure design for research, development, and testing focused on offensive security Conducts periodic scans of networks to find and detect vulnerabilities Performs client penetration testing to find any vulnerabilities or weaknesses that might be exploited by a malicious party, using open-source, custom, and commercial testing tools Ability to assist in scoping engagements by clearly articulating various penetration approaches and methodologies to audiences ranging from highly technical to executive personnel Report generation that clearly communicates testing and assessment details, results, and remediation recommendations to clients Develop scripts, tools, and methodologies to automate and streamline internal processes and engagements Conducts IT application testing, cybersecurity tool and systems analysis, system and network administration, and systems engineering support for the sustainment of information technology systems (mobile application testing, penetration testing, application, security, and hardware testing) Conduct threat hunting and/or compromise assessment engagements to identify active or dormant indicators of compromise (IoCs) using Crypsis and Palo Alto Networks’ threat hunting tools (and/or client owned hunting instrumentation where applicable) Assist Crypsis Leadership in the development of security standards and best practices for the organization and recommend security enhancements as needed Able to conduct cyber risk assessments using frameworks or standards like NIST CSF, ISO 27001/2, PCI, CIS Top 20, CMMC, or other industry measurement tools Conduct cloud penetration testing engagements to assess specific workloads (i.e., AWS, GCP, Azure, containers, or other PaaS and SaaS instances) for vulnerabilities and subsequently attempt to exploit identified weakness after receiving permission from client stakeholders Provide recommendations to clients on specific security measures to monitor and protect sensitive data and systems from infiltration and cyber-attacks including response and recovery of a data security breach Ability to perform travel requirements as needed to meet business demands (on average 30%) Qualifications Your Experience 4+ years of professional experience with risk assessment tools, technologies, and methods focused on Information Assurance, Information Systems/Network Security, Infrastructure Design, and Vulnerabilities Assessments Demonstrate a deep understanding of how malicious software works (i.e.-malware, trojans, rootkits, etc.) Ability to modify known and/or craft custom exploits manually without dependence on consumer tools such as Metasploit Strong knowledge of tools and techniques used to conduct network, wireless, and web application penetration testing Familiarity with web application penetration testing and code auditing to find security gaps and vulnerabilities Knowledge and experience in conducting cyber risk assessments using industry standards Experience with penetration testing, administering, and troubleshooting major flavors of Linux, Windows, and major cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS providers (i.e., AWS, GCP, and Azure) Experience with scripting and editing existing code and programming using one or more of the following - Perl, Python, ruby, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java Experience with security assessment tools, including Nessus, OpenVAS, MobSF - Metasploit, Burp Suite Pro, Cobalt Strike, Bloodhound, and Empire Knowledge of application, database, and web server design and implementation Knowledge of network vulnerability assessments, web and cloud application security testing, network penetration testing, red teaming, security operations, or 'hunt' Knowledge of open security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic tools, technologies, and methods Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security, or equivalent years of professional experience to meet job requirements and expectations or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Unit 42 Consulting is Palo Alto Network's security advisory team. Our vision is to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. Our team is composed of recognized experts and incident responders with deep technical expertise and experience in investigations, data breach response, digital forensics, and information security. With a highly successful track record of delivering mission-critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide an effective incident response, attack readiness, and remediation plans with a focus on providing long-term support to improve our clients’ security posture. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com. Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $127,600/yr to $159,500/yr. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. wireless, and web application penetration testing Familiarity with web application penetration testing and code auditing to find security gaps and vulnerabilities Knowledge and experience in conducting cyber risk assessments using industry standards Experience with penetration testing, administering, and troubleshooting major flavors of Linux, Windows, and major cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS providers (i.e., AWS, GCP, and Azure) Experience with scripting and editing existing code and programming using one or more of the following - Perl, Python, ruby, bash, C/C++, C#, or Java Experience with security assessment tools, including Nessus, OpenVAS, MobSF - Metasploit, Burp Suite Pro, Cobalt Strike, Bloodhound, and Empire Knowledge of application, database, and web server design and implementation Knowledge of network vulnerability assessments, web and cloud application security testing, network penetration testing, red teaming, security operations, or 'hunt' Knowledge of open security testing standards and projects, including OWASP & MITRE ATT&CK Ability to read and use the results of mobile code, malicious code, and anti-virus software Knowledge of computer forensic tools, technologies, and methods Bachelor’s Degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Digital Forensics, Cyber Security, or equivalent years of professional experience to meet job requirements and expectations or equivalent military experience required Additional Information The Team Unit 42 Consulting is Palo Alto Network's security advisory team. Our vision is to create a more secure digital world by providing the highest quality incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services to clients of all sizes. With a highly successful track record of delivering mission-critical cybersecurity solutions, we are experienced in working quickly to provide an effective incident response, attack readiness, and remediation plans with a focus on providing long-term support to improve our clients’ security posture. Company Description Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together. Your Career We're seeking innovators - engineers who seek to design new products, designing state-of-the-art products that do not exist today. These engineers love to code with a drive to build global products and bring new ideas to develop security disciplines to solve real-world problems. We are looking for leaders who take ownership of their areas of focus and who are driven to pursue problems at every level. Collaboration is at the heart of our culture and we need engineers who can communicate at a high level and work well with multi-functional teams towards achieving a common goal. Job Description Your Career We are looking for a motivated, intelligent, hardworking and creative person to join the Detection Service team as a Senior Data Scientist. You will be part of a team that develops content to power the next-generation firewall for providing cloud-based malware detection and threat research using machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) techniques. You will be applying network security knowledge and machine learning techniques to detect advanced threats and attacks. You will be working as a “full-stack” data scientist who analyzes the malware behavior, develops the ML/DL models and delivers it in the production environment for customers. Your Impact Learn how next-generation firewalls inspect network packets Gain hands-on experience with building production-grade ML/DL models for threat detection Directly impact the detection efficacy through ML/DL model delivery in Advanced Threat Prevention products Work closely with the infrastructure team for data engineering pipeline and automatic model training pipeline Develop the detection solutions and integrate the solutions into the Palo Alto Networks’ next-generation firewall using Google Cloud infrastructure Collaborate with cross-team members to convert your research into multiple products, patents, research publications, blogs etc. Qualifications Your Experience Expert knowledge of Big Data Analysis and ML/DL algorithms techniques Tracking record of successfully building ML/DL models with high accuracy and low false alarms Good understanding of standard ML/DL toolkits (Spark, SQL, Pandas, Sklearn etc) Be able to interpret the ML/DL results and improve the model to the required quality level Good understanding of network security and layer-7 traffic analysis, such as HTTP, SSL etc Good experience with traffic analysis tools (e.g. wireshark, tcpdump), reverse engineering tools, exploitation/environment reproduction Good programming skills, Python/scripting language or Go experience is preferred Experience with Google Cloud toolkit is a plus BS/MS in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Network Security, Information Security, or related fields is required Additional Information The Team Our Security Services Team is responsible for building next-generation threat prevention and antivirus solutions and shipping high-quality content to our products to prevent successful cyberattacks. The areas include malware analysis, IoT security, Web security, network security, privacy protection. Engineering is at the core of our products and connected directly to the mission of preventing cyberattacks. We are constantly innovating — challenging the way we, and the industry, think about cybersecurity. Our engineers don’t shy away from building products to solve problems no one has pursued before. We define the industry instead of waiting for directions. We need individuals who feel comfortable in ambiguity, excited by the prospect of a challenge, and empowered by the unknown risks facing our everyday lives that are only enabled by a secure digital environment. Our Commitment We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
